availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Warren Marshall (caldwell + union co., ky, saddler and pvt (csa))

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, saddler and soldier. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Son of Martha Marshall. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed by George Cunningham as a saddler in Caseyville in 1860. Served in the 2nd (Woodward's) Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 327B-328A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Caseyville, p. 561.
"John Warren Marshall (1837-1896),", Find A Grave, Memorial #88130556, accessed May 24, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88130556.
